node.title: Seth Meyers: Steve Bannon Fancies Himself to Be Logan Roy
node.alt: “Also, it really undercuts your attempt at defiance and bravado when there’s a guy right behind you holding up a sign that says ‘Coup plotter,’” Meyers said on Monday night.
node.description: Meyers said Bannon was more like “a coked-up flunky who would get hired to help cousin Greg shred some documents and accidentally screw it up.”
node.content: ["Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night\u2019s highlights that lets you sleep \u2014 and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.", "Steve Bannon turned himself in to the F.B.I. on Monday morning after refusing to provide information related to the events of Jan. 6. Bannon made a statement in which he referred to himself as \u201cCaptain Bannon\u201d and promoted his political podcast.", "Seth Meyers, referring to the hit HBO series \u201cSuccession,\u201d joked that Bannon \u201cdefinitely likes to think of himself as a Logan Roy type, but he\u2019s more like a coked-up flunky who would get hired to help cousin Greg shred some documents and accidentally screw it up.\u201d", "Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Ernie Hudson talked with Jimmy Fallon on Monday\u2019s \u201cTonight Show\u201d about reuniting for the newest movie in the \u201cGhostbusters\u201d franchise.", "The retired N.B.A. star Dwyane Wade will talk about his new memoir on Tuesday\u2019s \u201cLate Show.\u201d", "Mindy Kaling\u2019s new HBO Max series, \u201cThe Sex Lives of College Girls,\u201d treats undergraduate intimacy with the friendly skepticism it deserves."]
